column1: 'review': "As a long-time fan of the Counter-Strike series
column2: it pains me to say this ‚Äî but CS2 is a massive disappointment.\r\n\r\nTerrible matchmaking ‚Äì Even in casual games
column3: the matchmaking is completely unbalanced. There's no sense of fair competition
column4: and the ranking system feels meaningless.\r\n\r\nNo real anti-cheat ‚Äì The cheating problem is out of control. Even in casual matches
column5: cheaters are everywhere. Wallhacks
column6: aimbots ‚Äî you name it. It ruins the experience entirely.\r\n\r\nThe game is unplayable because of cheaters ‚Äì Right now
column8: there‚Äôs a cheater on the enemy team blatantly walling
column9: seeing us through walls and pre-aiming every move. How is this acceptable?\r\n\r\nWith frustration and disappointment
column10: I‚Äôve uninstalled CS2. Until Valve takes cheating seriously and implements a proper anti-cheat system

column2: a time when the internet still buzzed with the sound of dial-up modems and cybercaf√©s were sacred temples for young gamers. That‚Äôs where I first discovered Counter-Strike. Back then
column3: it was just a Half-Life mod ‚Äî a simple idea: terrorists vs. counter-terrorists. But for me
column4: and for many from my generation
column5: Counter-Strike was much more than that.\n\nI remember my first matches on maps like de_dust and cs_assault. Games full of adrenaline
column7: and shouting between friends whenever someone pulled off an epic play‚Ä¶ or died in the dumbest way. But it was also in those servers where I met the people who
column8: without realizing it at the time
column9: would become my best friends.\n\nAs time passed
column13: some of us became parents. I now have several kids
column15: a life that no longer revolves around spending afternoons at a LAN caf√©. But one thing hasn‚Äôt changed: I still play Counter-Strike. Not every day
column16: of course. Sometimes once a month
column17: maybe twice. But always with the same friends. We log in
column18: even if it‚Äôs just for an hour
column19: and we‚Äôre back to being those kids from the 2000s ‚Äî yelling through our headsets
column21: and coming up with absurd strategies that never actually work.\n\nThe most beautiful part is that now my kids watch me play
column22: asking about that ‚Äúold game‚Äù I like so much. Some of them have even started playing it too. I tell them that thanks to Counter-Strike
column23: I have my best friends. That it was more than a game; it was a bridge between eras
column25: a space where we‚Äôre still ourselves
column26: no matter how much our lives change.\n\nCounter-Strike didn‚Äôt just define a gaming era ‚Äî it defined a part of my life. And as long as I can lift a mouse and hit the ‚Äúbuy AK-47‚Äù key
column28: in the server with my lifelong friends. Because some matches

column1: 'review': 'I am writing to express my deep frustration with the current state of VAC and the overall gameplay experience in CS2.\n\nVAC appears to be ineffective ‚Äî cheaters are rampant
column2: and player reports seem to have no impact whatsoever. It‚Äôs extremely disheartening to invest time in a competitive game mode like Premier
column3: only to encounter obvious cheaters with no consequences. At this point
column4: it feels like using cheats has become a requirement to stay competitive
column5:
which is unacceptable.

The lack of visible moderation or effective anti-cheat measures has resulted in a very poor and frustrating experience for legitimate players. I sincerely hope Valve takes this issue seriously and commits to improving VAC and its enforcement systems.

Thank you for your attention.'

column3: new mechanics

column5: undeniably
column6:
a work-in-progress.

üî• Source 2 engine feels smoother.  
üî• Responsive smokes and better sound design are game changers.  
üî• Guns have more ‚Äúweight‚Äù now ‚Äî both visually and mechanically.

BUT‚Ä¶

‚ùå Hit reg still isn't consistent.  
‚ùå MM servers need serious attention.  
‚ùå UI feels like it was designed for touchscreen toddlers.

CS2 *feels* like a beta dressed as a release. Still
column7:
there's no game that captures the tension of a 1v5 clutch quite like this one.

üéØ Pro tip: Play with friends or prepare for solo queue suffering.

"

column1: 'review': "I've played for 19 hours and I can say that Counter-Strike 2 is a solid update to the classic shooter. The graphics and lighting are much improved
column2: the gunplay feels smooth and responsive
column3: and the new features add a fresh twist to the familiar gameplay. However
column4: there are still some performance issues and occasional bugs that need fixing. Despite that
column5: it's a fun and competitive experience
column6: especially with friends. I recommend it to anyone who enjoyed CS:GO or wants to try a fast-paced tactical shooter.\r\n\r\n"

column1: 'review': 'its a good game if you have a crew and have time to practice and get better!'
